title: Memorials and remains of medical research in Africa: an anthropology of scientific landscapes, ruins and artefacts
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText: We have used our findings to interrogate issues of equity in transnational medical research partnerships, and to provide grounding for heritage and cultural work on memory of the late colonial and postcolonial state and its services and enterprises. organisation: London Sch of Hygiene and Trop Medicine
findingsText: Combining archival and ethnographic methods, we have focused on the material forms and practices of remembering (and forgetting) medical research around three medical research stations in Sub-Saharan Africa, examining ruination and renovation, living memory and amnesia, and memory work at sites in Cameroon, Senegal, and Tanzania. Our material archive and scholarly findings have been inserted into dialogue with heritage and science planning apparatus in host countries, as well as with artists based in Africa, Europe and North America.
